_header: Saint Petronilla the holy maid right is to have in mind
Subjects: saints’ lives; Petronilla, saint, life of
_description: Life of St. Petronilla in the South English Legendary — couplets

Bod779.First Lines:
Seint pernel þe holy mayd ryȝt is to haue in mendegood
                    womon ȝhe was ȝhe auȝte wel be kende…
Bod779.Last Lines:
…to heuen ȝhe went clene mayd & is wit outin
                    endyngnow god for þe loue of here to þilke ioy vs
                    bring

BodEngPoeta1.First Lines:
Seint Pernele þat holi Mayde riht is to habben in muyndeGood
                    wommon heo was inouȝ heo ouȝte wel beo kuynde…
BodEngPoeta1.Last Lines:
…To heuene clene Maide heo wende þat is wiþ outen
                    endyngeNow God for þe loue of hire to þulke Ioye vs bringe.
                    Amen
BodEngPoeta1.Facsimiles:
Doyle,  I. A.,
                        ed.  
             The Vernon Manuscript. A Facsimile of Bodleian Library, Oxford, MS Eng.
                poet.a.1,
          with an introduction by A. I. Doyle. Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1987. 
Scase,  Wendy,  and  Nick Kennedy, eds.  
             A facsimile edition of the Vernon manuscript: Oxford, Bodleian Library, MS. Eng. Poet. A. 1.
         Oxford: The Bodleian Library, 2011.

BLEge1993.First Lines: Seint purnele þe holi maide riȝt is to habbe in mindeGod wommon heo was inow heo auȝte wel bi kuynde…
BLEge1993.Last Lines: …To heuene clene maide heo wende & wiþ outen endingeNow god for þe loue of hire to þilke ioie vs bringe

BLSto949.First Lines: Seynt pernel þat holy mayde riht it is to habbe in myndeHeo was good wumman ynou vor heo ouhte wel by kynde…
BLSto949.Last Lines: …Clene mayde to hevene neo wente & þere is wiþ outen endeNow god for here swete loue to þulke ioye make vs wende
BLSto949.Note: Ends “Amen” at end of last line.
